title: {Flex Queue} This doesn't seem right...
body:
Well I saw that I had to redo a game to get properly ranked for flex. Now when i first started I was placed Gold 2. I dropped to gold 3 because lost a bit but managed to start winning get back to gold 2 and was on the way to gold 1. This seemed right to me because I was actually plat 5 last season and sitting in the high gold/low plat range.

So when i redid my placements can anyone explain why i got silver 2? I was expecting gold 5 at worst. I did so well in my game to redo my placement. (2/2/20 Bard Game 63% KP).
I was on a winning streak about to get into gold 1 as well so it wasn't like I didn't belong... 

So my question is do I wait for another  fix or do I have to farm through silver? To be quiet honest this seems really unfair.
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body:
That didn't explain anything at all. What a cop out this is. So ultimately I got screwed over thanks. Wasted hours of my time on climbing.


{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
There appear to still be some unusual cases, but any updates should be in either of those threads.

Yeah I understand you don't know whats happening. Though you have to understand that this is really depressing for me. I worked my tail off to get out of silver/gold. Only to be put back in silver 2 after this supposed fix... its depressing. I can't even play with some of my friends now...
I know it's frustrating, but the point was that the matchmaking was so dodgy it was unfair. Just have faith that if you could climb out before you can climb out again.
So punishing me and putting a support main down lower than his actual elo is fair.... yeah right.... Well im too depressed to do anything so eh.
P5 0LP doesn't mean you had P5 mmr. You have to drop a lot of mmr before you get demoted out of a 5 div. S2 is not unreasonable from a G3-4~ mmr.

If i made it to plat in one season then why can't I do it again. Just need an attitude adjustment. 

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

Ofc you can :) The best I can do I'm afraid is to explain how you ended up where you did as best I can. I am still limited to the same information you have so I can really only offer a diff perspective.
